questions.name: onset
questions.label: Did the headache start very suddenly (within a minute)?

questions.name: neuro
questions.label: Any weakness, confusion, or vision problems?

questions.name: injury
questions.label: Head injury in the past 7 days?

questions.name: duration
questions.label: How long has this headache been going on?

alerts.message: Sudden severe headache can be serious. Seek urgent medical assessment.
Neurological changes or recent head injury need same-day medical advice.
Headaches lasting more than a week should be checked by a GP.

questions.name: breathing
questions.label: Any wheeze, chest tightness, or breathing difficulty?

questions.name: eyeSymptoms
questions.label: Are your eyes very red, painful, or affected by discharge?

questions.name: pregnancy
questions.label: Is the person pregnant or breastfeeding?

questions.name: ageGroup
questions.label: Who is this for?

alerts.message: Breathing difficulty with allergies needs urgent medical review.
Pregnancy and breastfeeding require pharmacist advice before treatment.
Young children with hay fever should be assessed by a pharmacist or GP.

questions.name: alarm
questions.label: Difficulty swallowing, vomiting blood, or unexplained weight loss?

questions.name: chestPain
questions.label: Is the pain spreading to your arm, jaw, back, or with shortness of breath?

questions.name: duration
questions.label: How long have the symptoms been present?

questions.name: tried
questions.label: Treatments already tried

alerts.message: Urgent assessment is needed for alarm symptoms or chest pain with indigestion.
Persistent indigestion longer than 3 weeks should be reviewed by a GP.

questions.name: blood
questions.label: Any blood or black, tarry stools?

questions.name: fever
questions.label: High fever (above 38.5°C)?

questions.name: duration
questions.label: How long have the loose stools lasted?

questions.name: travel
questions.label: Recent travel abroad?

alerts.message: Blood in stool needs urgent medical advice.
High fever with diarrhoea requires assessment by a clinician.
Diarrhoea lasting more than 5 days should be reviewed by a GP.
Recent travel with diarrhoea can indicate infection – seek advice.

questions.name: breathing
questions.label: Any difficulty breathing, drooling, or struggling to swallow saliva?

questions.name: rash
questions.label: Is there a widespread rash or are you feeling very unwell?

questions.name: duration
questions.label: How long has the sore throat lasted?

questions.name: contact
questions.label: Close contact with someone diagnosed with scarlet fever, strep throat, or COVID-19?

alerts.message: Breathing or swallowing difficulty needs urgent medical help.
Severe rash or feeling very unwell should be checked by a clinician.
Sore throats lasting longer than a week require GP review.
